channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping, 20th November
item.description:
Mattress, two wheelie bags flytipped which cant be collected with usual rubbish

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dalston Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trash in pond, 20th November
item.description:
Trash in pond has been present for months, needs removing. Lots of plastic bottles and other rubbish. Ducks are swimming with it To locate: Enter Danson park from Radnor Avenue entrance. Continue forward/straight on the path until bridge reached. Algea pond on the left while standing on centre of the bridge, lots of rubbish in it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Lane, Welling, Bexleyheath, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sofa and various other furniture items have been dumped at the end of my road, 20th November
item.description:
The items have been there for at least a week

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Bartram Road, Honor Oak, Lewisham, London Borough of Lewisham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple Lime bikes dumped blocking pavement, 20th November
item.description:
Multiple Uber/Lime bikes dumped strewn across the pavement (lying down not upright) on corner of Stean Street and Dunston Street. That plus a pile of bin bags severely reducing accessibility.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunston Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large collection of bin bags left on the corner, 20th November
item.description:
Large pile of waste collection bags / refuse left on the corner of Stean Street and Dunston Street. Bags are marked Hackney waste. Is this allowed? That plus a load of dumped Uber/Lime bikes (will do a separate report) severely reducing accessibility

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunston Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
